citations.narrative:
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review during the inspection. There were no records of the
number of guinea pigs held or died since May 2025.
Failure to maintain records can make it difficult to identify trends in animal losses, which could indicate disease conditions.
The licensee must maintain records containing the required information for animals which disclose the number of guinea
pigs held, owned, or disposed of including births and deaths.
Correct by December 23, 2025.

Several of the guinea pig enclosures had an accumulation of excreta and dirty bedding. The pen used to isolate the sick
guinea pigs, had approximately 6 inches of built up excreta and dirty bedding. In at least 10 of the primary enclosures, the
area surrounding the water spigot had a build up of debris and excreta.
Ineffective cleaning and sanitation can expose the guinea pigs to disease hazards, create odors, and attract pests.
Correct by ensuring that primary enclosures for guinea pigs are cleaned and sanitized often enough to prevent an
accumulation of excrete or debris and sanitized at least once every 2 weeks.
Correct by December 23, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
